word_mean: 生物对进入其体内的有害元素积累的忍耐能力。

sentence.Network_en: In 1741 Catherine the Great issued an edict of toleration for Buddhism.
sentence.Network_cn: 1741年，叶卡捷琳娜大帝颁布法令，允许佛教的存在。

sentence.Network_en: Religious minorities were allowed a wide measure of toleration.
sentence.Network_cn: 宗教少数派获得广泛的宽容对待.

sentence.Network_en: He preached toleration for all religions.
sentence.Network_cn: 他宣扬要容许所有的宗教信仰.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (denoting the granting of permission by authority): from French tolération, from Latin toleratio(n-), from tolerare (see tolerate)

entry.def: If you tolerate a situation or person, you accept them although you do not particularly like them.

example.ex: She can no longer tolerate the position that she's in...
example.tran: 她再也受不了自己的处境了。

example.ex: The cousins tolerated each other, but did not really get on well together.
example.tran: 这对表亲互相容忍，但是相处得并不真正融洽。

entry.def: If you can tolerate something unpleasant or painful, you are able to bear it.

example.ex: The ability to tolerate pain varies from person to person.
example.tran: 对疼痛的忍受力因人而异。

means.word_mean: 1. a disposition to tolerate or accept people or situations;

sentences.sentence: "all people should practice toleration and live together in peace"

means.word_mean: 2. official recognition of the right of individuals to hold dissenting opinions (especially in religion)

auth_sentence.content: He also proposed the withdrawal of toleration from groups and movements .

auth_sentence.content: Locke advocated religious toleration and opposed the divine right of kings.
auth_sentence.res_content: Locke advocated religious toleration and opposed the divine right of kings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Locke advocated religious toleration and opposed the divine right of kings.

auth_sentence.content: The signs of a growing toleration or indifferentism meet him on every side.
auth_sentence.res_content: The signs of a growing toleration or indifferentism meet him on every side.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The signs of a growing toleration or indifferentism meet him on every side.

sentences.en: He preached toleration for all religions.
sentences.cn: 他宣扬要容许所有的宗教信仰。

sentences.en: Religious minorities were allowed a wide measure of toleration.
sentences.cn: 宗教少数派获得广泛的宽容对待。

sentences.en: Toleration,moreover,is something which is won,not granted.
sentences.cn: 容忍,是从艰苦中争取来的,不是别人赏赐的。
